title: Pink + purple theme polish, consistent UI, improved verse layout, and chapter search

requirements.summary: Update global theme to pink background with purple typography accents while preserving readable light/dark modes and not editing shadcn ui source components.
acceptanceCriteria: In light mode, the app background is visibly pink (not peach/ivory) across all tabs/pages (Home, Read Gita, Talk to Krishna, Discover).
Purple is used intentionally for emphasis (e.g., headings/active states) without reducing contrast below readable levels for body text.
Dark mode remains available and readable; purple accents remain visible and consistent in dark mode.
No changes are made to any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose components instead).

file_operations.description: Adjust CSS variable tokens for light/dark themes so --background is a clearly pink canvas across the app, and set primary/ring/accent tokens to a purple-forward palette that maintains readable contrast for foreground/body text.

Ensure Tailwind theme extensions (fonts, radii, shadows) support the updated pink/purple token strategy (e.g., add/adjust shadow presets and any needed semantic utilities) without relying on edits to frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Refine bottom tab active/hover styling to use the updated purple accents clearly (active state emphasis and readable inactive state) while keeping the four-tab structure unchanged.

requirements.summary: Refine UI/UX to match the screenshot direction (soft pink canvas, airy spacing, rounded cards, serif-forward hero headings, clean navigation states) and fix visual inconsistencies across pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Home, Read Gita, Discover, and Talk to Krishna share a consistent spacing system (padding, gaps) and consistent card radii/shadows.
Primary and secondary button styles are consistent across the app (pill buttons, predictable hover/press states).
Typography hierarchy is consistent (page titles, section titles, body text, captions) and visually aligned with the screenshot direction.
Navigation active state styling is clear and consistent (active tab stands out using purple accents).

file_operations.description: Add a small set of reusable global utility classes (via Tailwind layers) for consistent spacing, soft card styling, and pill button conventions to reduce per-page inconsistencies (no changes inside frontend/src/components/ui).

Update hero typography to be serif-forward where appropriate (e.g., headline), tune spacing and section rhythm to feel airy, and align CTA/button styling with consistent pill/hover states. Continue using shadcn-ui Button/Card components via composition only; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align Read Gita list layout with consistent card radii/shadows/spacing and headline hierarchy; ensure interactions (hover/press) match the rest of the app using composed shadcn-ui Card/Button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Normalize spacing, typography hierarchy, and verse list card styling so it matches the screenshot direction and other pages; keep interactions subtle and consistent using composed shadcn-ui components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refine mood grid spacing and card styling for consistency (rounded corners, soft elevation, clean focus/hover states) and align headings/subtext with the global typography scale using composed shadcn-ui Card. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure CTA button style matches global primary button conventions (pill, consistent hover/press), and align section spacing and verse list rhythm with the rest of the app using composed shadcn-ui Button/Skeleton. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Unify chat page spacing, header styling, and background overlays with the global theme; ensure button/icon states match the updated purple accent system using composed shadcn-ui Button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Standardize follow-up question chips as secondary/pill buttons with consistent hover/press/focus styling that fits the pink/purple theme, using composed shadcn-ui Button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update verse presentation so every verse card shows the 4 required parts with explicit labels and a clearly separated, always-visible action step, with responsive layout.
acceptanceCriteria: VerseCard labels explicitly use “Literal Hindi translation” and “Literal English translation” (not just “Meaning”).
Sanskrit is available for every verse and is not effectively hidden (either shown by default or the control to reveal it is clearly visible and discoverable).
The UI is responsive: on small screens the four parts are stacked cleanly; on larger screens the layout may use a multi-column/grid presentation without losing readability.
The action step is always displayed and visually distinct from the translations/interpretation.

file_operations.description: Revise VerseCard to present the four parts (Sanskrit (original), Literal Hindi translation, Literal English translation, Gen‑Z interpretation) with explicit labels; ensure Sanskrit is shown by default or the reveal control is prominent; implement a responsive stacked-to-grid layout; keep the action step always visible and visually distinct. Use shadcn-ui Card/Button via composition only and do not edit frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the verse detail view layout complements the updated VerseCard (consistent padding/spacing, readable width, and header hierarchy) without introducing new routes or tabs.
Adjust chat rendering spacing around VerseCard (and Krishna message container) to match the updated verse presentation and global card rhythm, keeping readability strong in both themes.

requirements.summary: Add an in-page search/filter input to the Read Gita chapter list to filter chapters client-side by English title and Sanskrit subtitle without changing the four-tab structure.
acceptanceCriteria: Read Gita chapter list includes a search input that filters chapters client-side by English title and Sanskrit subtitle.
Search is case-insensitive and updates results as the user types.
Clearing the search restores the full 18-chapter list.
The existing navigation structure (four tabs) remains unchanged.

file_operations.description: Add a client-side search input above the chapter list; filter fetched chapters by englishTitle and sanskritSubtitle (case-insensitive) as the user types; ensure clear/empty restores full list; keep existing Read Gita flow and four-tab navigation unchanged. Use shadcn-ui Input (or an equivalent composed input pattern) and existing Card/Skeleton styles without editing frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
